snippet: In postelection interviews, dozens of black New Yorkers said Bill de Blasio’s personal touch and biracial family had affected them deeply.
abstract: Many black New Yorkers express deep connection to Bill de Blasio, claiming his mayoral victory as their own; de Blasio, who captured 96 percent of black vote, won admiration with his pledge to help the working class and poor, and to fight back on divisive policies like stop-and-frisk.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael Barbaro, Kia Gregory, Winnie Hu, Sarah Maslin Nir, Julie Turkewitz and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: In postelection interviews, dozens of black New Yorkers said Bill de Blasio’s personal touch and biracial family had affected them deeply.

headline.main: Many Black New Yorkers Are Seeing de Blasio’s Victory as Their Own
headline.print_headline: Many Blacks See de Blasio’s Victory as Their Own
